section.title: HTML5 Introduction
section.description: Everything you need to know to get started with HTML5
section.longDescription:
In order to create both simple and advanced JavaScript apps, hybird mobile apps, web apps or anything else that uses some kind of browser to render HTML to show a useful output to the user, you need to know HTML.

HTML is not programming it is just a very simple mark up language, and if your familiar with XML then getting to grips with HTML will be a very quick process.

These resources will presume you currently know nothing about HTML, XML or anyother web technologies, so you might want to skip the first few sections if you already know a bit.

Everything in these tutorials relates to HTML5, which is the latest version, and will continue to be for the next few years.
section.author: Alicia Sykes

section.title: CSS Introduction
section.description: Key information you need to know to get started and use CSS3 for styling your web pages
section.longDescription:
As we've seen HTML can be used to build out the structure of your website, and dissplay content, in the form of text, images, and multimedia. But everything you write in HTML will just display using the browsers default styles, usually Times New Roman and in black and white.

To change the appearence of your web content, we add styles to it using CSS.

CSS stands for cascading style sheets, and the latest version is CSS3.

In this article we'll show you how to use CSS to add styles to your HTML web page.

link.text: CSS Tricks - Really good reference blog with loads of CSS tips and tricks, makes a good read

section.author: Alicia Sykes

section.title: JavaScript Introduction
section.description: Adding dynamic functionality to webpages with basic JavaScript
